IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The primary role of the university is to provide post-secondary instruction and research in the humanities, sciences, social sciences and other areas of human, intellectual, cultural, social and physical development.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The University of Saskatchewan belongs to the people of Saskatchewan. As an academic community, our mission is to achieve excellence in the scholarly activities of teaching, discovering, preserving and applying knowledge.
IRS990.Desc: The University of Saskatchewan's primary role is to provide post-secondary education and research in the humanities, sciences, social sciences and other areas of human, intellectual, cultural, social and physical development. The University offers instructional programs leading to graduate and undergraduate degrees, certificates and diploma programs and post-graduate clinical (residence) programs.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: Director, Global Institute for Food Security
Dean, College of Arts and Science

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Collections of Artifacts, Archival Materials and Rare Books: The University has acquired collections of artifacts, archival materials and rare books. These items have been accumulated largely as adjuncts to the University's research and teaching missions. Acquisitions are donated as well as purchased. The University rarely disposes of items from this collections. Art Collections: The Kenderdine Art Gallery administers the permanent art collections of the University. The collection includes works of art that provides a historical or artistic context for objects that are already in the collection as well as works that are of a historical interest to the University of the Province of Saskatchewan. Proceeds from the sale of objects are used for the purpose of new acquisitions or the direct care of the collections.
Endowment Funds provide stable annual funding to support the purpose of the University.

Cost of goods sold are reported as expenses in the Audited Financial Statements but offset revenue in part VIII line 10b. Direct expenses from fund raising events are reported as expenses in the audited financial statements but offset revenue in part VIII line 8b.

Cost of goods sold are reported as expenses in the Audited Financial Statements but offset revenue in part VIII line 10b. Direct expenses from fund raising events are reported as expenses in the audited financial statements but offset revenue in part VIII line 8b.
Information available upon request from the public
Educational grants are received from the provincial government of Saskatchewan

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: As the University of Saskatchewan operates in Canada, its grants and other assistance expenditures are conducted outside of the United States. For monitoring procedures related to grants see the following website: http://policies/research-and-scholarly-activities/administration-of-research-funds.php

Dean, College of Arts and Science

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A discretionary spending account is available to key employees for business purposes. As well each employees receives a discretionary health spending amount. The University provides the president with the use of the University residence. The residence is used to host University's events and functions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Five members of the Board are appointed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council, two members are elected by the senate, one member is a student, and one is a faculty member.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Data within the form 990 was reviewed by the Controller of the organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A market review of similar positions at comparator universities is conducted, recommendations for salary increase budget are submitted to the Board of Governors for approval. Individual salary increase decisions are based on market/merit models made by the provost/VPs, the Provost for the Deans and the Board of Governors for the President. The salary Review Committee chaired by the Provost meets to finalize merit pay decisions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 17
Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governance documents are available to the public at: http://www.usask.ca/secretariat/governing-documents/index.php. Financial statements are available within the annual reports at: http://www.usak.ca/reporting/annual_reports/index.php. Conflicts of interest documents are available at:http://www.usask.ca/university_secretary/policies/operations/4_01_01.php

Other changes in net assets or fund includes the difference (0.0471) between the current year exchange rate (0.7791) and the prior year exchange rate (0.7320) for the following: Prior year end fund balance (from audited financial statements) $2,333,387,973.06*(0.7320) = (A) $USD(1,708,039,996.28), current year fund balance (from the audited financial statements) $2,333,387,973.06*(0.7791) = (B) $USD(1,817,942,569.81), the difference (C) $USD(109,902,573.53); other changes in net assets or fund balances includes an increase of $12,288,000*0.7791= (A) $USD9,573,580.80 due to the re-measurement of the employee future benefits required under Canadian Generally Acceptable Accounting Principles for Non-for-Profit Organizations. sum of (A) $USD 119,476,154.33.
